adapt.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation
adapt.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
The children are finding it hard to adapt to the new school.
flowers which are well adapted to harsh winters
How do these insects adapt themselves to new environments?
adapt.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to change something to make it suitable for a different purpose
adapt.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The car has been adapted to take unleaded gas.
These teaching materials can be adapted for older children.
adapt.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a book or play is adapted for film, television etc, it is changed so that it can be made into a film, television programme etc
adapt.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
adapt.translation[0].definitions[2].note: Adapt is usually passive in this meaning
